title: Cat Care Essentials
description: Understanding the needs of your feline friend is key to a happy and healthy relationship. Cats are independent, but they thrive on routine, a clean environment, and your affection.
sentences: Cats are obligate carnivores and need a high-protein diet; choose quality cat food (wet or dry).
Provide fresh, clean water at all times, preferably in a separate location from their food bowl.
A clean litter box is non-negotiable; scoop it daily and completely change the litter weekly.
Annual vet check-ups, deworming, and vaccinations are crucial for preventative healthcare.
Provide scratching posts to save your furniture and satisfy their natural instinct to scratch.
dos: Play with your cat daily using interactive toys to provide mental and physical stimulation.
Create vertical spaces like cat trees or shelves for them to climb and observe.
Brush them regularly, especially long-haired breeds, to prevent hairballs and matting.
Pay close attention to changes in their behavior, appetite, or litter box habits as they can be signs of illness.
donts: Don't feed them dog food, milk, onions, garlic, or chocolate as these can be toxic.
Don't use physical punishment; use positive reinforcement to correct behavior.
Don't declaw your cat; it is a painful and unnecessary amputation.
Don't let them roam freely outdoors unsupervised in busy urban areas to protect them from traffic and diseases.
